name: Carbon dioxide
description: Carbon dioxide (chemical formula CO2) is a colorless and odorless gas vital to life on Earth. This naturally occurring chemical compound is composed of a carbon atom covalently double bonded to two oxygen atoms
Ozone is a gas that can form and react under the action of light and that is present in two layers of the atmosphere
name: Ozone

description: Particulate Matter is the term for particles found in the air, including dust, dirt, soot, smoke, and liquid droplets
name: PM 2.5 microns

description: Carbon monoxide is a colorless, odorless, and tasteless gas that is slightly less dense than air
name: Carbon Monoxide

description: Temperature is an objective comparative measure of hot or cold. It is measured by a thermometer, which may work through the bulk behavior of a thermometric material, detection of thermal radiation, or particle kinetic energy
name: Temperature

description: Humidity is the amount of water vapor in the air. Water vapor is the gaseous state of water and is invisible
name: Humidity
